abstract.text: Update your apps to use new features, and test your apps against API changes.

inlineContent.text: The iOS & iPadOS 15 SDK provides support to develop apps for iPhone, iPad, and iPod touch devices running iOS & iPadOS 15. The SDK comes bundled with Xcode 13, available from the Mac App Store. For information on the compatibility requirements for Xcode 13, see

2 introduces a modern Swift-based API that takes advantage of new language features like Swift concurrency. Use this API to load product information, display in-app purchases in your store, allow customers to make purchases, manage access to content and subscriptions, and receive transaction information signed by the App Store in JSON Web Signature (JWS) format. Fixed an issue where purchases performed in the Sandbox environment returned
for transactions that have already finished. (81346114)
Audio Units now provides custom views that Audio Unit hosts can display in iOS. Use the
has a user interface. Use the
. The custom view supports setting the tint color of the view via the
property. This can be used to set the color of the view to a different color for each track or to match the look of the app. (74183251)
iPadOS apps can now continue using the camera while presenting multiple windows and being the only application onscreen. (77522226)
now resume playback mid-event if a paused
resumes. These events don’t begin mid-event if
starts the player at a specific time offset. (29274583)
You can now control whether to apply a volume envelope to
resources. By default, these resources play back with a built-in volume envelope that ramps the signal in at the beginning and ramps out at the end, to avoid clicks. (75491090)
You can apply a volume envelope in one of the following ways:
If you’re importing custom audio assets by registering audio resource IDs for them, you can specify this behavior via a new key value argument,
If you’re referencing audio assets using an AHAP file or the
, you can control this behavior with the
In automatic reference counting (ARC) mode, the compiler may extend the lifetime of
property is used. This may increase memory usage. (80895213)

framework is now available in iOS & iPadOS 15, unlocking new opportunities for building dynamic app experiences that leverage on-device ML. Task-focused APIs for image classification, sound classification, text classification, and hand pose and hand action classification are available, along with APIs for classical tabular classification and regression. (37087332)
algorithm trains sound classifier models faster, with higher accuracy, lower latency, and a smaller model size. This algorithm is now the default option for the
Using dispatch semaphores in an iOS app running in a device simulator on a Mac with Apple silicon running macOS 11 causes the app to crash. (81783378)
In Xcode, select Product > Scheme > Edit Scheme, then deselect Run > Options > Queue Debugging > “Enable backtrace recording.”
When your iOS device needs to be charged, text indicating that the Find My network is active only displays if the device language is set to English. (78547946)
When using Guided Access with VoiceOver, you might be unable to enter the Guided Access passcode to end Guided Access. (79370792)
If a device passcode is set, force restart your device to end Guided Access.
You can’t pair with Matter accessories that use Thread. (80991829)
You can’t pair a third-party app with Matter accessories through the app paring flow if the accessory is already paired with another app. (80059432)
Remove accessory pairing from other apps, then pair the third-party app.
You can’t add a flow to a third-party app with Matter accessories if you haven’t created an Apple Home. (80058744)
Launch the Home app to create a Home before you add a flow.
Matter accessories aren’t reachable while Apple TV is connected via Wi-Fi. (79582629)
Matter accessories might enter a No Response state after pairing. (76019163)

Remove the accessory from Home, reset the accessory, and add it back to Home. If the issue persists, remove your Home hub from Home and re-add it. If the issue still persists, remove the home and create a new one.
The initial pairing attempt with a Matter accessory might take an unexpectedly long time and eventually fail. (77967587)
You can only pair up to five Matter accessories in a home. (77967671)
Only the owner of a home, not an invited user, can pair Matter accessories. (76012945)
After canceling a search in the widget gallery, the cancel button remains visible, which might blank out the widget gallery. (78572049)
Dismiss and reopen the widget gallery.
iCloud Private Relay will be released as a public beta to gather additional feedback and improve website compatibility. (82150385)
Legacy Contacts has been removed from iOS & iPadOS 15 beta 5 and will return in a future release. (81292885)
Custom Email Domain addresses with delimiters like “+” or “-” can’t be configured. (82425376)
Custom Email Domain addresses that are associated with a separate iTunes account can’t be configured. (82358431)
Some accounts may not yet be eligible for Custom Email Domain. (82421769)

now includes an automatic grammar agreement engine. This simplifies your code and reduces the number of localized strings you provide by automatically inflecting localized strings to account for pluralization, grammatical gender agreement, and agreement with the user’s term of address. It’s available for English and Spanish. (70210115)
Formatting APIs are now available, which focus on the format and remove the need to create, configure, and cache a formatter instance. Each
function. These functions have arguments that allow for configuration and customization of the style. (70220307)
APIs provide a Swift interface to express archivable rules for sorting values. (74264359)

sends has an updated format and corrected values for multiple locales. In addition to the preferred language, the header also includes the current system language as a fallback if it differs from the preferred language. This behavior affects apps that link against macOS 12, iOS 15, tvOS 15, and watchOS 8 SDKs. (38772422)

inlineContent.text: Support for cleartext HTTP URL schemes for Proxy Automatic Configuration (PAC) is now deprecated. Use only HTTPS URL schemes for PAC. This affects all PAC configurations, including, but not limited to, configurations set via Settings, System Preferences, profiles, and

. If you configure a cleartext HTTP PAC URL, the system may upgrade it to HTTPS during PAC file loads. Web Proxy Auto-Discovery (WPAD) Protocol via DNS isn’t affected. Dynamic Host Configuration Protocol (DHCP) Option 252 WPAD may attempt to upgrade cleartext HTTP URLs to HTTPS during PAC file loads. (61981845)
To download a file that shows the app content in the App Privacy Report, choose Settings > Privacy > Record App Activity. (77758720)
You might be unable to create new projects in Reality Composer. (79418400)
Create a new project in Reality Composer on macOS and transfer the
file to your device via AirDrop or Mail.
The bottom tab bar is redesigned to appear below page content. An option to show the address bar at the top is also available. (81118141)
When tapping in an input field in a Safari Web Extension popover on iPhone, the Extension UI might not move upward to make room for the keyboard. (81676564)
SharePlay development in beta 7 and upcoming beta releases requires the installation of an updated
. This profile enables successful creation and reception of GroupSessions via the Group Activities API in iOS 15, iPadOS 15 and tvOS 15 beta 7, as well as macOS Monterey beta 6. (81816137)
Media items added to the default instance of
Touch and hold the Music Recognition Control Center module to view
VoiceOver and Spoken Content users might not initially see all available voice options. Voice options should populate after some time. (79463000)
On-device speech recognition only supports the following languages: Chinese (Mandarin - China mainland), English (Australia), English (Canada), English (United Kingdom), and English (US). (78483609)
If a developer opts-in to receive the winning postback, devices can now send a copy of the winning postback to the advertised app’s developer. (75054513)
is now available with the same character-counting behavior as a Swift string. It’s fully localizable, and also includes support for Markdown, Codable, strongly typed attributes, and more. (27227292)
API for receiving notifications using async/await. (74401384)
Swift libraries depending on Combine may fail to build for targets including ARMv7 and i386 architectures. (82183186, 82189214)
Use an updated version of the library that isn’t impacted (if available) or remove ARMv7 and i386 support (for example, increase the deployment target of the library to iOS 11 or higher).
Applications linking to RealityKit with the iOS 15 or macOS 12 SDKs will fail to launch on a previous OS. (79584511)
to your Xcode Project settings to allow running RealityKit apps on an older OS.
While the Sound Actions feature work as part of Switch Control, sounds aren’t detected in the area marked Practice in Settings app. (82411537)
can now contain Markdown syntax. The system parses Markdown strings when you create a
views created with a string literal. The system styles
respects the styles you provide through attributes within the SwiftUI attribute scope; these styles take precedence over styles you provide through view modifiers. (74841755)
Specific kinds of animations now execute off the main thread, so there are new thread-safety requirements. (70524799)
Ensure the following functions and types are thread-safe:
All methods and accessors of types conforming to the protocols

parameter to specify an explicit placeholder for the field. (61260160)
While searching, if you tap a suggestion that uses the
modifier, the suggestion list now disappears rather than displaying the single suggestion you selected. (76965399)

requires deferring the focus state property update to the next time the main runloop runs. (78607356)

is a new Swift framework you use to analyze and manipulate tabular data. You can use
to read CSV and JSON files, as well as join, group, and aggregate data. (69982458)

For apps compiled against the iOS 15 beta SDK, key commands no longer intercept text input and text editing commands while typing into text views and text fields. For example, pressing the Delete key always deletes a character and doesn’t trigger a Delete key command if one is present. To have a key command intercept text input, set the
on the key command. This is also required to have key commands take priority over focus keyboard navigation commands, such as arrow and tab key presses. (55118263)
In iOS 14 and iPadOS 14 and earlier, when

, the QuickType bar is disabled. For apps linked against iOS 15 and iPadOS 15 or later, the QuickType bar is enabled and shows spellchecking candidates. If the new behavior isn’t desirable for your use case, set
When compiling with the iOS 15 beta SDK, several key window-related properties, methods, and notifications change behavior:
if the window is key in its scene instead of the app.
is called when the window becomes key in its scene instead of the app.
posts when the window becomes key in its scene instead of the app.
is called when the window resigns key window status in its scene instead of the app.
posts when the window resigns key window status in its scene instead of the app. (72873846)
functionality, such as loading content with music requests, doesn’t work in simulated devices. (78559381)

abstract.text: Specifies the recommended settings for use with an `AVAssetWriterInput`.
Extracts and returns the captured photo’s primary image as a Core Graphics image object.
Extracts and returns the captured photo’s preview image as a Core Graphics image object.
Returns the list of uncompressed pixel formats supported for photo data in the specified file type.
Returns the list of Bayer RAW pixel formats supported for photo data in the specified file type.
Returns a video settings dictionary appropriate for capturing video to a file with the specified codec and type.
A class that defines a host’s interface to an audio unit.
A Boolean that indicates whether the audio unit provides a user interface, normally in the form of a view controller.
Requests an audio unit’s custom view controller.
Downloads a proxy autoconfiguration script and executes it.
A type of object with a publisher that emits before the object has changed.
The base class to extend when creating a custom user interface for an audio unit.
A protocol that defines an advanced pattern player capable of looping, seeking, pausing, and resuming haptic playback.
Jumps to the specified offset time in playing the haptic.
A key for a Boolean value that indicates whether audio file playback fades in and out using an envelope.
Registers an external audio to use as a custom waveform.
An audio event with a looped waveform of arbitrary length.
An audio event using a waveform that you supply.
A haptic event with a looped waveform of arbitrary length.
The type of the haptic event.
An object representing a haptic waveform.
Creates a haptic pattern from a property list dictionary.
Create machine learning models for use in your app.
A machine learning model you train with audio files to recognize and identify sounds on a device.
An annotation view that displays a pin image on the map.
A pin-shaped annotation used to indicate a location on a map.
Integrate your app with Apple Music.
A unified logging system for the reading of historical data.
An object that represents the user’s Shazam library.
Support In-App Purchases and interactions with the App Store.
Information about a product that you configure in App Store Connect.
Optional settings for a product purchase that add account information, purchase details, and offers, or that specify behaviors.
Adds a string for a custom key to a purchase.
Adds a number for a custom key to a purchase.
Adds data for a custom key to a purchase.
Adds a Boolean value for a custom key to a purchase.
Indicates whether a transaction needs to continue if the App Store storefront changes on the device during the transaction.
The JSON representation of the subscription renewal information.
The renewal status information for an auto-renewable subscription.
An asynchronous sequence that listens for new subscription status information.
The signed renewal information for the auto-renewable subscription.
Requests product data from the App Store.
The user canceled.
The region and unique identifier of the App Store storefront for the device.
An asynchronous sequence that listens for changes to the storefront.
The asynchronous sequence that emits storefront information when the system updates the storefront.
Information that represents the customer’s purchase of a product in your app.
An asynchronous sequence of transactions.
The JSON representation of the transaction information.
A sequence that emits unfinished transactions for the customer.
The asynchronous sequence that emits a transaction when the system creates or updates transactions that occur outside the app or on other devices.
A type that describes the result of a StoreKit verification.
The verified value of the signed type that StoreKit confirms as verified.
The associated value of the verification result that StoreKit doesn’t confirm as verified.
A type that provides asynchronous, sequential, iterated access to its elements.
A type that can be compared for value equality.
A type that can be hashed into a `Hasher` to produce an integer hash value.
A class of types whose instances hold the value of an entity with stable identity.
A unit of asynchronous work.
A type that you use to create custom alignment guides.
A type that describes how to animate a property of a view.
A modifier that can create another modifier with animation.
The underlying value referenced by the binding variable.
A type that applies standard interaction behavior and a custom appearance to all buttons within a view hierarchy.
A view that shows or hides another content view, based on the state of a disclosure control.
A key for accessing values in the environment.
A collection of environment values propagated through a view hierarchy.
An action that opens a URL.
A property wrapper type that can read and write a value that SwiftUI updates as the placement of focus within the scene changes.
A structure that computes views on demand from an underlying collection of identified data.
An effect that changes the visual appearance of a view, largely without changing its ancestors or descendants.
A container view that defines its content as a function of its own size and coordinate space.
A control for navigating to a URL.
A container that presents rows of data arranged in a single column, optionally providing the ability to select one or more members.
A protocol that describes the behavior and appearance of a list.
The list style that describes the behavior and appearance of an inset grouped list.
The key used to look up an entry in a strings file or strings dictionary file.
A view that controls a navigation presentation.
A structure that computes views and disclosure groups on demand from an underlying collection of tree-structured, identified data.
Creates an outline group from a root data element and a key path to its children.
A named value produced by a view.
A 2D shape that you can use when drawing a view.
A view that displays one or more lines of read-only text.
A control that displays an editable text interface.
A type that can serve as the animatable data of an animatable type.
A type that represents part of your app’s user interface and provides modifiers that you use to configure views.
Defines the content shape for hit testing.
A modifier that you apply to a view or another view modifier, producing a different version of the original value.
Import, organize, and prepare a table of data to train a machine learning model.
A collection that arranges data in rows and columns.
A Boolean value that indicates whether the key command takes precedence over text input or focus movements.
Disables autocorrection behavior.
The autocorrection style for the text object.
The spell-checking style for the text object.
Disables spell-checking behavior.
The first nondefault tint color value in the view’s hierarchy, ascending from and starting with the view itself.
The view that the controller manages.
Tells the window that it’s the key window.
A notification that posts whenever a window becomes the key window.
A notification that posts whenever a window resigns its status as main window.
A Boolean value that indicates whether the window is the key window.
Tells the window that it’s no longer the key window.

Access essential data types, collections, and operating-system services to define the base layer of functionality for your app.
A value type for a string with associated attributes for portions of its text.
Attribute scopes that SwiftUI defines.
A type that converts a given data type into a representation in another type, such as a string.
An abstract class that declares an interface for objects that create, interpret, and validate the textual representation of values.
An object that decodes instances of a data type from JSON objects.
An object that converts between JSON and the equivalent Foundation objects.
A comparator that uses another sort comparator to provide the comparison of values at a key path.
A notification dispatch mechanism that enables the broadcast of information to registered observers.
An abstract class that declares an interface for objects that create, interpret, and validate the textual representation of values.
A comparison algorithm for a specified type.
A serializable description of how to sort numerics and strings.
An object that coordinates a group of related, network data transfer tasks.
A dictionary containing information about the proxy to use within this session.
An object for writing interpolated string messages to the unified logging system.
An object for measuring task performance using the unified logging system.
Begins a signposted interval.
Marks a point of interest in time.
Ends the signposted interval that corresponds to the specified name and state.
Measures the execution of a closure and attaches the specified message.
Logs a point of interest in your code as a time interval or as an event for debugging performance in Instruments.
